greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n as an orderless product of orderless sums.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Dirichlet g.f.: Product_{k>=2} 1 / (1 - k^(-s))^p(k), where p(k) = number of partitions of k (A000041). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Oct 26 2019
program: (PARI) MultEulerT(u)={my(v=vector(#u)); v[1]=1; for(k=2, #u, forstep(j=#v\k*k, k, -k, my(i=j, e=0); while(i%k==0, i/=k; e++; v[j]+=binomial(e+u[k]-1, e)*v[i]))); v}
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Sep 05 2018
